issue.title: Change the suggestion about adapters and `enqueue_after_transaction_commit`
issue.body:
After discussing with @dhh about this, Solid Queue will set this to `:always` by default so the comment could be confusing for people using it with the same DB as the app.

See https://github.com/rails/solid_queue/issues/212#issuecomment-2278493163

body: Yes. No work was done to fix this yet
Hii, @rafaelfranca Please help with what needs to be done here. Can someone else take it up?

If possible, it'd be easier if this could be hadled in ActiveJob rather than in all potential queue adapter, here's the error I recently encountered using AWS SQS Shoryuken adapter:

```ruby
NoMethodError: undefined method `enqueue_after_transaction_commit?' for 
  #<ActiveJob::QueueAdapters::ShoryukenAdapter:0x00007f31ebda9b60> (NoMethodError)
    queue_adapter.enqueue_after_transaction_commit?
```

issue.title: Update ActiveJob's enqueue_after_transaction_commit config
issue.body:
This PR modifies the configuration for ActiveJob's `enqueue_after_transaction_commit` option to accept only boolean values and defaulting to `true`.

Closes #52675

body: @rafaelfranca I've opened an initial PR here: #53336

issue.title: Add enqueue_after_transaction_commit? for Rails 7.2 compatibility

repository.name: shoryuken
repository.description: A super efficient Amazon SQS thread based message processor for Ruby.

issue.body:
For Rails 7.2 there is a new method `enqueue_after_transaction_commit?` required on an ActiveJob adapter class - see:

https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/dfd1e951aa1aeef06c39fffb2994db8a8fa1914f/activejob/lib/active_job/queue_adapters/abstract_adapter.rb#L10-L16 and https://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveJob/QueueAdapters/AbstractAdapter.html#method-i-enqueue_after_transaction_commit-3F

issue.title: Deprecate setting `config.active_job.enqueue_after_transaction_commit`
issue.body:
Also change the configuration to be a boolean instead of a symbol.

The value of this setting isn't delegated to the queue adapter anymore, since the behavior that this setting controls is too dangerous to leave this change of behavior as something that users don't control.

Fixes #52675.
